title: Public Records Request for Body Cam Footage – Deltona Middle School Arrest

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request for Body Cam Footage – Deltona Middle School Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all available body camera footage related to the arrest of Jorge Rivera and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino at Deltona Middle School on November 19, 2024.

To assist in locating the footage, here are the details of the incident:

- Date of Event: November 19, 2024
- Location: Deltona Middle School, Deltona, Florida
- Arresting Agency: Volusia County Sheriff’s Office
- Involved Deputy: School Resource Officer (female deputy)
Suspects:
- Jorge Rivera (46 years old)
- Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45 years old)
Incident Description:
-  The parents arrived at Deltona Middle School to protest their son being charged with battery for pushing a classmate.
- Jorge Rivera allegedly became irate during the meeting with the school resource officer, yelling insults and refusing to leave when asked.
- While in the school hallway, Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino allegedly shoved the officer, and Jorge Rivera then punched the officer in the face.
- The officer attempted to use a Taser but was knocked to the ground during the altercation.
- Jorge Rivera allegedly took the officer’s Taser before both suspects were subdued and arrested.
- The deputy sustained a concussion and was treated at a hospital.
Charges:
- Battery on a law enforcement officer
- Resisting with violence
- Disruption of a school function
- Trespassing on school grounds
- Armed robbery and grand theft (Jorge Rivera only, for taking the deputy’s Taser)
I am requesting any body camera footage related to this incident, including:

1. The initial interaction between the deputy and the parents inside the school.
2. The altercation in the hallway and subsequent struggle.
3. The arrest and any relevant post-arrest footage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to body camera footage and any additional records regarding incidents involving Marlena Velez, who was arrested for alleged theft at the Target store in Cape Coral, Florida, on October 30, 2024 and November 20, 2024. Specifically, I am seeking footage recorded by officers during or after the incidents where Marlena Velez was allegedly involved in shoplifting. According to reports, Velez, a TikTok influencer, was arrested for stealing merchandise, including $225 worth of goods during the second incident, following an earlier theft on October 30. In addition to the body cam footage, I am interested in any available surveillance video, arrest records, or other related documents that might help provide a comprehensive view of these incidents. To assist in locating the footage, here are the key details of the incidents: Date of Incident 1: October 30, 2024 Date of Incident 2: November 20, 2024 Name: Marlena Velez (suspect) Location of Incident: Target store, Cape Coral, Florida,

Any and all communications concerning the Austin Public Library's Enhanced Library Card program between employees of the City of Austin and federal agencies, including but not limited to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and Border Patrol. communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: James A. Pruitt Criminal History
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records related to James A. Pruitt's (DOB: Sept. 1958; deceased as of July 5, 2003) criminal history including, but not limited to, probable cause affidavits, police reports, jail records, and confidential informant records.

I am interested in any and all documentation related to the following cases:
- Case No. 02CR167105 - May 27, 2022 (13th Judicial Circuit) - Domestic Assault
- Case No. 03CR164150 - Jan. 4, 2003 (13th Judicial Circuit) - Peace Disturbance
- Case No. CR198057278F - Possession of a Controlled Substance
- Case No. CR0196051197F - Stealing
- Case No. 13R019651197 -  July 22, 1996 (13th Judicial Circuit) - Criminal Infraction 
- Case No. 13R019651197-01 - July 16, 1996 (13th Judicial Circuit) - Stealing
- Jan. 4, 2003 - Tampering with evidence or victim' evidence
- Case No. 13R019649096 - Jan. 23, 1996 - Stealing
- Case No. 13R019442995 - June 24, 1994 - Unlawful use of drug paraphernalia
- Case No. 13R019548134 - Oct. 17, 1995 - Hindering prosecution
- Case No. 13R019857278-01 - Jan. 19, 1997 - Possession of a Controlled Substance
- Case No. 13R019756747 - Jan. 4, 1998 - Stealing
- Case No. 13R019756747 - July 12, 1994 - Peace Disturbance

The list above is not exhaustive. I am requesting any additional arrest, jail, police, and other related records for James A. Pruitt that are available.

Additionally, if Mr. Pruitt served as a confidential informant for the Boone County Sheriff's Department or nearby police enforcement agencies, I would like to request any related records as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marc Howard

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: paragon
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The requested records are those, for the period between January 1, 2022 and the date on which this request is processed, describing and relating to the relationship between this agency and Paragon Solutions and any relationships between any representative of either entity.
Responsive records include, but are not limited to, documents concerning or mentioning Paragon Solutions and any representative thereof, including all documentation regarding its Graphite platform and any other service or software provided by or created by Paragon Solutions. These include, but are not limited to, the following:
CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Paragon Solutions, including all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation. More information about the contract in question can be found here: https://www.usaspending.gov/award/CONT_AWD_70CTD024P00000012_7012_-NONE-_-NONE-. 
FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the relationship between the aforementioned entities. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. This also includes any Requests for Proposal and bidding materials provided by Paragon Solutions and any other entities responding to the same Request for Proposal or equivalent procurement request.
DOCUMENTATION OF USE
• Any logs of use and other data obtained from the Paragon Solutions platform. Should query logs exist for any other platform, service, or software created and/or provided by Paragon Solutions, these materials are also responsive to this request.
• Any audits and reports of audits of use of Paragon Solutions platforms

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cooper Quintin

title: US Navy support for 2025 film "Captain America: Brave New World"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: US Navy support for 2025 film "Captain America: Brave New World"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the U.S. Navy and the production of the 2025 movie "Captain America: Brave New World," directed by Julius Onah and starring Harrison Ford and Liv Tyler. I request any and all documents pertaining to Navy support for "Captain America: Brave New World." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the Navy and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Captain America: Brave New World," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Your verification code
communications.communication: Your confirmation code is 039058

communications.subject: Navy FOIA Request 2025-NavyFOIA-003907 - Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Carollo: 

The Department of the Navy received your Freedom of Information (FOIA) / Privacy Act (PA) request dated February 5, 2025, and placed it in queue for processing by order of receipt on the same day. 

Unusual circumstances arise when a response within the statutory 20-day period may not be attainable due to: 

1. Collection and search for records from a facility outside of this office. 
2. Volume of records that may be responsive to your request. 
3. Consultation with one or more agencies having a substantial interest in the determination or the subject matter. 

The Navy FOIA program is decentralized, requiring our office to search and gather documents from Navy component offices which are not geographically co-located. Per the Department of the Navy FOIA/PA regulation 32 CFR §701.8(g)(2), this office grants itself an extension of ten days response time. We appreciate your patience and understand the importance of timely responses to FOIA requests and apologize for any inconvenience this delay may cause. 

Additionally, please be aware that the U.S. Navy’s new FOIA portal, Secure Release, is online. For your convenience, you may now submit FOIA requests online at www.SecureRelease.us or www.FOIA.gov. 

Please direct questions to the FOIA Service Center by phone (202) 685-0412 or send via email don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil. 

U.S. Navy Headquarters (FOIA) 
2000 Navy Pentagon 
Washington, DC 20350-1200 
don-foia-pa@us.navy.mil

communications.subject: REQ-2025-2211
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Dawson,

DMV acknowledges receipt of your request received on February 5, 2025.

I am writing to request clarification on your request. There may be some confusion about your request regarding the California ID Card program.

The CAL ID program is a program that exist to give ex-inmates an ID card upon release, however you have included ICE and Border Patrol in your list of federal agencies . Are you asking for communications regarding the inmate ID card program or for communications regarding AB 1766, also known as the "CA ID for All?"

Thank you.


[cid:image001.png@01DB77DA.86218080]
Jae Ahn | Attorney
Legal Affairs Division
California Department of Motor Vehicles
O: 916.657.6469 |

Confidentiality Notice: This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message.

Cory Dawson

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W673087-020525
communications.communication:
Dear Cory Dawson: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of San Antonio. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of  the Texas Government Code, known as the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 2/5/2025 and given the reference number W673087-020525 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s). You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
In accordance with the Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, the City of San Antonio makes all of its public records available to citizens. 
 
The Public Information Act does not require governmental bodies to create new information, perform legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. The City of San Antonio will not comply with a standing request for information to be collected or prepared in the future. 
 
The City of San Antonio will respond within ten business days following submission of requests.  The City of San Antonio may collect a fee as prescribed by law for the requested documents. For more information on the Texas Public Information Act, please visit the Texas Attorney General Web site at www.oag.state.tx.us 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
 SA Open Records

title: George W. Bush Library: Lou Pearlman Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: George W. Bush Library: Lou Pearlman Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents related to boy band empresario Lou Pearlman. A recent Netflix special included the assertion that in the immediate aftermath of 9/11, Pearlman was able to directly call President Bush in order to clear Pearlman's private plane to fly. 



News coverage of the Netflix special described this Pearlman/Bush connection as: 

"However, his (Pearlman's) connections were so significant that he called President George W. Bush to request special permission to allow the members of Natural to fly. Not only did President Bush grant special permission, but he also sent special planes to pick them up in New York. Lou Pearlman was so powerful that he could bypass strict national laws for his personal benefit. Pearlman quite literally defied the attacks on September 11, 2001—not even something as severe as that could stand in his way."

Here's a link to news coverage of the Netflix special:

https://screenrant.com/netflix-dirty-pop-boy-band-scam-documentary-shocking-reveals/

If any such documents exist, this is a request for:

Any correspondence between Lou Pearlman and President Bush 
Any correspondence from Governor Jeb Bush that mentions Pearlman 
Any record of a phone call between Pearlman and Bush in the aftermath of 9/11
Any record of President Bush's effort to assist Pearlman's flight
Any photographs of Pearlman and President Bush or Laura Bush together 

Thank you for the Bush library's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request until it reaches resolution.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Obama Library: NSC Correspondence Related to May 2013 "Drone Playbook" Fact Sheet

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Library: NSC Correspondence Related to May 2013 "Drone Playbook" Fact Sheet
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, email threads, or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the drafting of the May 2013 publication on the Whitehouse.gov website of a "drone playbook fact sheet." The formal name of this document is: "U.S. Policy Standards and Procedures for the Use of Force in Counterterrorism Operations Outside of the United States and Areas of Active Hostilities." This document was a carefully crafted public statement regarding drone use by the Obama administration. Please be sure to include a search of pre-publication emails that transmitted all fact sheet drafts (including as attachments) before it was published. 

An archived version of this document is located at: https://web.archive.org/web/20130525000828/https://www.whitehouse.gov/sites/default/files/uploads/2013.05.23_fact_sheet_on_ppg.pdf
News media coverage of controversies surrounding the release of this playbook can be easily found online: https://www.politico.eu/article/obama-to-release-drone-playbook/

In order to limit the scope of this request, please limit the time range for relevant documents from January 20th 2009 until the date in May 2013 when the fact sheet was published. In order to expedite this request, documents related to the 2013 to 2016 battle to release the "Presidential Policy Guidance (PPG)" memo need NOT be part of this request. 

Thank you for the Obama Presidential Library's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you towards resolving this request

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

The SoMa West CBD was established in 2019, as of 2020-21 had an annual assessment of $3,859,195.14, and runs a Safety Ambassador Security Task Force:
https://sfmayor.org/article/mayor-london-breed-signs-legislation-establishing-soma-west-community-benefit-district

 Camden County Administration   
 520 Market Street, 8th Floor 
 Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
Dear Georgetown PJI: 
 
Thank you for submitting an Open Public Records request with Camden County. Your request was given the reference number W031384-020525 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Our office will forward your request to the appropriate Department for their review and search of their files for the requested records. A written response will be sent to you within seven business days or sooner depending on the type of records requested. 
 
 
Please note that day one of the calculation begins the day after the custodian receives your OPRA request. This calculation applies to the agency’s actual business days of operations which are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. If the agency is closed for a Holiday, this date does not count towards the seven business day deadline. Any request received after the close of business will be deemed received on the next business day. 
 
You may monitor the progress of your request at the link below. Additionally, you will receive an email from our office to inform you when your request has been completed and a response is posted at the below link.

title: Financial Records, Grant Allocations, and Correspondence Related to Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence (CCADV) and Connecticut Comptroller’s Office (Office of the State Comptroller) (Office of the State Comptroller)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E), I demand expedited processing based on:
✅ Urgency of public interest – The request involves government transparency, potential conflicts of interest, and the use of taxpayer funds.
✅ Risk of improper financial influence – Given Sean Scanlon’s position as Connecticut Comptroller and Meghan Scanlon’s leadership at Connecticut CCADV, there is a clear need for immediate disclosure.To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

02/01/2025
Financial Records, Grant Allocations, and Correspondence Related to Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence (CCADV) and Connecticut Comptroller’s Office
Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Legally Binding Public Records Demand

To:
Due to the complexity of government agencies, departments, sub-departments, and committees involved in this request, and in light of my disability, I formally request that all recipients of this FOIA request forward it to any and all relevant offices, divisions, personnel, or agencies that may hold responsive records.

This request is made in accordance with FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552), the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12132), and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794), ensuring my full and equal access to government records. I ask for reasonable assistance in processing this request, including identifying appropriate record holders and ensuring that all relevant entities conduct a thorough search including but not limited to the the following people and agencies listed below.

Federal Bureau of Investigation FBI
Connecticut Office of the Comptroller
Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
Connecticut Office of Policy and Management (OPM)
Connecticut Governor’s Office
Connecticut Office of Victim Services (OVS)
U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) – Office of the Inspector General (OIG)
U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) – Office on Violence Against Women

Date: February 1, 2025

Subject: Immediate FOIA Request – Financial Records, Grant Allocations, and Correspondence Related to Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence (CCADV) and Connecticut Comptroller’s Office
This request is submitted under my constitutional rights, whistleblower protections, and taxpayer interests pursuant to the following laws:

✅ Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552)
✅ Connecticut FOIA laws (Conn. Gen. Stat. §§ 1-200 et seq.)
✅ First and Fifth Amendments (Freedom of Information & Due Process Rights)
✅ Whistleblower Protection Act (5 U.S.C. § 2302)
✅ False Claims Act (31 U.S.C. §§ 3729–3733)
✅ Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act (31 U.S.C. § 6101)
✅ Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.)
✅ Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794)

This FOIA request is made in the interest of government accountability, financial oversight, and transparency regarding Connecticut’s Medicaid ABI Waiver Program and potential conflicts of interest involving CCADV and the Connecticut Comptroller’s Office.

1. Connecticut State Budget Allocations to CCADV (2020–2025)
🔹 All state budget line items, funding allocations, and appropriations for domestic violence programs that provided funding to CCADV.
🔹 All discretionary grants, direct payments, or non-competitive funding allocations made to CCADV from Connecticut state agencies, including but not limited to DSS, OPM, and the Office of the Comptroller.
🔹 Records of budget changes, funding increases, or discretionary payments to CCADV since Meghan Scanlon became CEO.
🔹 Financial audits, budget justifications, and accountability reports related to CCADV funding.

2. Connecticut Comptroller’s Office – Transactions & Financial Oversight of CCADV
🔹 All financial disbursements from the Connecticut Comptroller’s Office to CCADV or any of its affiliated programs (2020-2025).
🔹 All contracts, agreements, invoices, or purchase orders involving the Connecticut Comptroller’s Office and CCADV.
🔹 All internal communications, memos, or correspondence related to CCADV funding, financial oversight, or policy decisions.

3. Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS) – Grant Funding to CCADV
🔹 All contracts, agreements, and funding disbursement records between DSS and CCADV.
🔹 All emails, memos, or correspondence between DSS officials and CCADV leadership (including Meghan Scanlon) regarding funding, policies, or budget increases.
🔹 Records of grant application processes, funding approval criteria, and justification for any discretionary funding increases to CCADV.

4. Connecticut Office of Policy and Management (OPM) – Discretionary Funding Oversight
🔹 All financial records and internal communications regarding CCADV’s funding through discretionary grants or state allocations.
🔹 All documentation detailing OPM’s approval, oversight, and monitoring of funds allocated to CCADV.

5. Governor’s Office – Policy Influence & CCADV Funding
🔹 All communications (emails, memos, reports) between the Governor’s Office and CCADV leadership regarding funding, legislative priorities, or advocacy initiatives.
🔹 All meeting minutes, directives, or internal memos discussing the Governor’s role in funding CCADV or influencing domestic violence program funding.

6. Connecticut Office of Victim Services (OVS) – Judicial Branch Grant Funding to CCADV
🔹 All financial records, grant allocations, and award justifications given to CCADV through OVS.
🔹 All documentation related to federal VOCA (Victims of Crime Act) and VAWA (Violence Against Women Act) grants distributed to CCADV through state agencies.

7. Federal Oversight – U.S. DOJ & HHS Inspector General
🔹 All federal grant distributions (FVPSA, VAWA, VOCA) allocated to CCADV through Connecticut agencies.
🔹 All audits, compliance reviews, or fraud investigations into CCADV’s use of state or federal funding.
🔹 All records related to whistleblower complaints, fraud disclosures, or conflicts of interest concerning CCADV and state agencies.

8. Legal Mandates for Compliance
✅ National Archives & Records Administration v. Favish, 541 U.S. 157 (2004) – Government transparency is a constitutional right.
✅ Judicial Watch v. DHS, 857 F.3d 564 (D.C. Cir. 2017) – Agencies must provide evidence that no records exist.
✅ Burlington Northern & Santa Fe Railway Co. v. White, 548 U.S. 53 (2006) – Government retaliation includes obstructing access to information.

EXPEDITED PROCESSING REQUEST
Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E), I demand expedited processing based on:
✅ Urgency of public interest – The request involves government transparency, potential conflicts of interest, and the use of taxpayer funds.
✅ Risk of improper financial influence – Given Sean Scanlon’s position as Comptroller and Meghan Scanlon’s leadership at CCADV, there is a clear need for immediate disclosure.

ADA & Civil Rights Accommodations
Under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794), I demand:
ADA Accommodations Request
This request includes explicit ADA accommodations to address cognitive processing challenges resulting from my traumatic brain injury (TBI). These accommodations are legally required under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132)
and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794).

Requested ADA Accommodations
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), I request the following accommodations for all communications and records:
Screen-Reader Compatible Formats

All documents must be provided in properly labeled PDFs or plain-text files.
Ensure that the documents are screen-reader compatible and retain clear, accessible formatting.
Exclusive MuckRock Platform Communication
All communications must occur exclusively via the MuckRock platform.
Do not send external links, emails, portals, passwords, codes, or require phone calls for access.
Text Embedded in Email Bodies

Key information must be embedded directly in the email body to facilitate comprehension and accessibility.

Simplified Summaries

Non-Negotiable Compliance

TIMEFRAME FOR RESPONSE
Pursuant to FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)) and Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(c), I expect:

CONSEQUENCES FOR NON-COMPLIANCE

title: Financial Records, Grant Allocations, and Correspondence Related to Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence (CCADV) and Connecticut Comptroller’s Office (Office of the State Comptroller) (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E), I demand expedited processing based on:
✅ Urgency of public interest – The request involves government transparency, potential conflicts of interest, and the use of taxpayer funds.
✅ Risk of improper financial influence – Given Sean Scanlon’s position as Connecticut Comptroller and Meghan Scanlon’s leadership at Connecticut CCADV, there is a clear need for immediate disclosure.To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

02/01/2025
Financial Records, Grant Allocations, and Correspondence Related to Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence (CCADV) and Connecticut Comptroller’s Office
Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Legally Binding Public Records Demand

To:
Due to the complexity of government agencies, departments, sub-departments, and committees involved in this request, and in light of my disability, I formally request that all recipients of this FOIA request forward it to any and all relevant offices, divisions, personnel, or agencies that may hold responsive records.

This request is made in accordance with FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552), the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12132), and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794), ensuring my full and equal access to government records. I ask for reasonable assistance in processing this request, including identifying appropriate record holders and ensuring that all relevant entities conduct a thorough search including but not limited to the the following people and agencies listed below.

Federal Bureau of Investigation FBI
Connecticut Office of the Comptroller
Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
Connecticut Office of Policy and Management (OPM)
Connecticut Governor’s Office
Connecticut Office of Victim Services (OVS)
U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) – Office of the Inspector General (OIG)
U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) – Office on Violence Against Women

Date: February 1, 2025

Subject: Immediate FOIA Request – Financial Records, Grant Allocations, and Correspondence Related to Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence (CCADV) and Connecticut Comptroller’s Office
This request is submitted under my constitutional rights, whistleblower protections, and taxpayer interests pursuant to the following laws:

✅ Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552)
✅ Connecticut FOIA laws (Conn. Gen. Stat. §§ 1-200 et seq.)
✅ First and Fifth Amendments (Freedom of Information & Due Process Rights)
✅ Whistleblower Protection Act (5 U.S.C. § 2302)
✅ False Claims Act (31 U.S.C. §§ 3729–3733)
✅ Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act (31 U.S.C. § 6101)
✅ Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.)
✅ Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794)

This FOIA request is made in the interest of government accountability, financial oversight, and transparency regarding Connecticut’s Medicaid ABI Waiver Program and potential conflicts of interest involving CCADV and the Connecticut Comptroller’s Office.

1. Connecticut State Budget Allocations to CCADV (2020–2025)
🔹 All state budget line items, funding allocations, and appropriations for domestic violence programs that provided funding to CCADV.
🔹 All discretionary grants, direct payments, or non-competitive funding allocations made to CCADV from Connecticut state agencies, including but not limited to DSS, OPM, and the Office of the Comptroller.
🔹 Records of budget changes, funding increases, or discretionary payments to CCADV since Meghan Scanlon became CEO.
🔹 Financial audits, budget justifications, and accountability reports related to CCADV funding.

2. Connecticut Comptroller’s Office – Transactions & Financial Oversight of CCADV
🔹 All financial disbursements from the Connecticut Comptroller’s Office to CCADV or any of its affiliated programs (2020-2025).
🔹 All contracts, agreements, invoices, or purchase orders involving the Connecticut Comptroller’s Office and CCADV.
🔹 All internal communications, memos, or correspondence related to CCADV funding, financial oversight, or policy decisions.

3. Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS) – Grant Funding to CCADV
🔹 All contracts, agreements, and funding disbursement records between DSS and CCADV.
🔹 All emails, memos, or correspondence between DSS officials and CCADV leadership (including Meghan Scanlon) regarding funding, policies, or budget increases.
🔹 Records of grant application processes, funding approval criteria, and justification for any discretionary funding increases to CCADV.

4. Connecticut Office of Policy and Management (OPM) – Discretionary Funding Oversight
🔹 All financial records and internal communications regarding CCADV’s funding through discretionary grants or state allocations.
🔹 All documentation detailing OPM’s approval, oversight, and monitoring of funds allocated to CCADV.

5. Governor’s Office – Policy Influence & CCADV Funding
🔹 All communications (emails, memos, reports) between the Governor’s Office and CCADV leadership regarding funding, legislative priorities, or advocacy initiatives.
🔹 All meeting minutes, directives, or internal memos discussing the Governor’s role in funding CCADV or influencing domestic violence program funding.

6. Connecticut Office of Victim Services (OVS) – Judicial Branch Grant Funding to CCADV
🔹 All financial records, grant allocations, and award justifications given to CCADV through OVS.
🔹 All documentation related to federal VOCA (Victims of Crime Act) and VAWA (Violence Against Women Act) grants distributed to CCADV through state agencies.

7. Federal Oversight – U.S. DOJ & HHS Inspector General
🔹 All federal grant distributions (FVPSA, VAWA, VOCA) allocated to CCADV through Connecticut agencies.
🔹 All audits, compliance reviews, or fraud investigations into CCADV’s use of state or federal funding.
🔹 All records related to whistleblower complaints, fraud disclosures, or conflicts of interest concerning CCADV and state agencies.

8. Legal Mandates for Compliance
✅ National Archives & Records Administration v. Favish, 541 U.S. 157 (2004) – Government transparency is a constitutional right.
✅ Judicial Watch v. DHS, 857 F.3d 564 (D.C. Cir. 2017) – Agencies must provide evidence that no records exist.
✅ Burlington Northern & Santa Fe Railway Co. v. White, 548 U.S. 53 (2006) – Government retaliation includes obstructing access to information.

EXPEDITED PROCESSING REQUEST
Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E), I demand expedited processing based on:
✅ Urgency of public interest – The request involves government transparency, potential conflicts of interest, and the use of taxpayer funds.
✅ Risk of improper financial influence – Given Sean Scanlon’s position as Comptroller and Meghan Scanlon’s leadership at CCADV, there is a clear need for immediate disclosure.

ADA & Civil Rights Accommodations
Under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794), I demand:
ADA Accommodations Request
This request includes explicit ADA accommodations to address cognitive processing challenges resulting from my traumatic brain injury (TBI). These accommodations are legally required under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132)
and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794).

Requested ADA Accommodations
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), I request the following accommodations for all communications and records:
Screen-Reader Compatible Formats

All documents must be provided in properly labeled PDFs or plain-text files.
Ensure that the documents are screen-reader compatible and retain clear, accessible formatting.
Exclusive MuckRock Platform Communication
All communications must occur exclusively via the MuckRock platform.
Do not send external links, emails, portals, passwords, codes, or require phone calls for access.
Text Embedded in Email Bodies

Key information must be embedded directly in the email body to facilitate comprehension and accessibility.

Simplified Summaries
Provide plain-language summaries for complex or legal documents to ensure clarity and understanding.

Identification of Responsible Officers
Include the full name, title, and contact information of all responsible officers handling this request.

Non-Negotiable Compliance
These accommodations are non-negotiable and are essential for ensuring equal access to information. Failure to provide the requested accommodations may constitute a violation of the ADA and the Rehabilitation Act. Thank
you for ensuring compliance and accessibility in addressing this request.

FEE WAIVER REQUEST
Pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii), I request a full fee waiver as:
✅ The request serves the public interest by ensuring transparency in government financial transactions.
✅ I am a whistleblower and journalist seeking information for public benefit, not commercial gain.

TIMEFRAME FOR RESPONSE
Pursuant to FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)) and Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(c), I expect:
🔹 Acknowledgment within 4 business days.
🔹 Full response within 20 business days, or a legal justification for any delays.

CONSEQUENCES FOR NON-COMPLIANCE
Failure to comply by February 15, 2025, will result in:
✅ Formal FOIA appeals with U.S. DOJ Office of Information Policy (OIP).
✅ Complaint to Connecticut Freedom of Information Commission (FOIC).
✅ Judicial enforcement through federal and state courts.

FINAL NOTICE
This is a binding legal request under FOIA and state laws. Non-compliance will result in legal escalation and public exposure.

I expect immediate acknowledgment.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

*** Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)
Urgent Request for Investigation into OSC Case Records, Altered Decisions, and Suppressed Reports

Formal FOIA Request Submission and Accommodation Request for Forwarding to Relevant Parties

To all agencies, departments, and individuals included within this FOIA request:

This is a legally binding Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552, Connecticut FOIA laws (Conn. Gen. Stat. §§ 1-200 et seq.), and all applicable federal and state transparency statutes.

This request is submitted in the interest of government accountability, financial oversight, and public transparency regarding the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, the Connecticut Comptroller’s Office, and any funding, contracts, or oversight related to the Connecticut Coalition Against Domestic Violence (CCADV).

Accommodation Request:
Under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794), I formally request that this FOIA request be forwarded to any departments, offices, or personnel that may hold responsive records.

Additionally, to ensure accessibility and compliance with federal disability law, I request that:
✅ All records be provided in screen-reader compatible formats (searchable PDFs, plain-text files).
✅ Key findings be embedded directly in email responses (rather than external portals).
✅ All communications regarding this request remain within the original email chain for clarity and tracking.

Failure to forward this request as required by law, or failure to provide an exhaustive search and production of responsive documents, may be considered noncompliance under FOIA and will be subject to appeal, administrative complaints, and legal escalation if necessary.

A full response is expected within the statutory deadlines of FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)) and Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(c).

David Medeiros
ABI Resources

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Synthesia
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Documentation and training materials regarding the department's use of the Synthesia software
2. All videos generated using the software, along with the scripts used to generate the videos and any accompanying metadata, particularly the creator of the video.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 1971 Records About Bangladesh
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-     Any documented phone calls, telegrams, and other communications amongst Department of State staff members in reference to the country of Bangladesh, its people, and its language that occurred between March and December of 1971.

-     Any lines of communication between Department of State staff members and Bangladeshi leaders, including the country’s Prime Minister, that occurred during the aforementioned time period.

-     Any documents about Bangladesh’s Liberation War of 1971 that are not already available on the National Archives catalog.

Responsive documents will be made available to the general public. Additionally, this request is being made for personal and not commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if possible. If only paper files are available, please send them to my mailing address listed below.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kavi Shahnawaz
(215) 964-5790
4508 Locust St. 
Philadelphia, PA 19139

If that status is "On Hold", please review the email you received and provide the requested information. If you did not receive an email, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center via email at FOIAStatus@state.gov. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov) 
If that status is "Closed" or "Documents Delivered", then the Department's response will be emailed or mailed (via US Postal Service). Please check your email account (including junk/spam mail) for the Department's response OR allow 7 to 10 business days to receive the Department's response by US Postal Service mail.
Regards, 
U.S. Department of State

title: SPD Body camera footage of June 26 encampment sweep

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: SPD Body camera footage of June 26 encampment sweep
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

From 11:30 AM to 3:00 PM, all footage from body cameras of responding officers to the dispersal of the South River encampment on June 26, 2024.

In particular, the body camera footage of:

C.I.U. Supervisor Sgt. Sean Andrus
C.I.U. Specialist Ofc. Ryan Arundel
C.I.U. Specialist Ofc. Dan Musto
C.I.U. Specialist Ofc. Neil Sicard
C.I.U. Specialist Ofc. Joshua Gerrard

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. I am currently a student journalist at Emerson College that has reported on the South River encampment in the past. The nature of this request is one of transparency regarding a widely-publicized encampment sweep and falls squarely within the public interest of some of our City's most vulnerable. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Nuñez

communications.subject: Re: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: SPD Body camera footage of June 26 encampment sweep
communications.communication:
We have received your request for possible records and a response will be provided within 10 business days per Mass Public Records Law<https://www.sec.state.ma.us/pre/prepdf/guide.pdf> to your respective request; distribution of information being requested may take longer indicative of the nature and or volume of information being sought. Thank you for your patience.

**Note - Depending on the volume of records which you are requesting (and or needs to be searched to fulfill this request), we will communicate prior to completing your request a 'cost estimate' (and timeframe) in accordance with Mass Public Records Law<https://www.sec.state.ma.us/pre/prepdf/guide.pdf> for the completion/distribution of the information which you are requesting.

In the event we are not the 'Keeper of the Record' for the information you are seeking or 'No records Found' we will do our best to instruct you to the correct agency for the information being requested.

If this office can be of further assistance in the interim, please let us know.

Respectfully,


Ann Marie Greene
